reviewText: These are well made, sturdy little hoops for my second piercing.  I would disregard any reviews that complains about their size. The first piercing has a 12mm hoop for comparison.

I got these for my three year old that had a bad reaction and infection with the post earrings that her ears were pierced with. After doing A LOT of searching online, I read that the circle shape of these allows for airflow, thus promoting healing. I ordered the 14K gold ones in case her infection was caused by a metal allergy. These are tiny! They look and work great in her little ears, but it was VERY difficult putting them in. Her ears were already swollen and trying to get these to close with an active infection was tough. I almost threw in the towel to let her ears close up and try again in a few years, but she begged me not to. Once I DID get these to close, we diligently cleaned her ears three times a day applying anti- bacterial each time. After a few days, we saw a difference. Now, a couple weeks later, her ears are almost completely healed. I would recommend these, but put them in either right away, or as soon as you see a problem. If little ears are irritated already, don't put your little one through it. Also, some review I read said 6-7 year old were wearing these. I have a six year old, and I cannot see how these would work for her. I think three to four would be the oldest I would recommend for these.

I wanted an rfid/slim wallet and there weren't a lot of choices.  After several searches, I came across this.  It's got a high quality feel, you can pack in a few extra cards if you need to.  It doesn't feel like it's going to fall apart on me.  If you like minimalist wallets, you'll like this.

Simple is what I like and this wallet delivers for a minimal lifestyle. Holds a few cards and some bills in the middle. Feels like a quality piece. Also, this company does it right and fixed a shipping problem I had. Awesome!

I got this wallet for a friend and he loved it. It halves the size of his normal wallet, but he can still easily fit all of the essentials inside. The brown finish also looks legit. I'm considering getting one for myself!
Great for overseas travel
Works
Very cheaply made. Would not recommend unless you don't mind poor quality.

rounded corners make a huge difference sliding into a pocket. Very slim. It's tight so you'll need to want a thin wallet to put up with the extra effort to insert and remove items. Perfect for me though.

Excellent wallet for the money.  I was looking for a minimalist wallet and stumbled on this one from their website.  The website was very difficult to navigate, but a quick e-mail from the courteous people at Shamrock Wallets later, I was sent here.

Don't expect to jam fifty cards in this wallet.  If you need that many cards or that much wallet space, you're probably not a minimalist.  It's like fitting into skinny jeans.  Some people shouldn't try.  Hopefully I didn't offend anyone.  They do have other options for good prices.  I would highly recommend this company.

The wallet has acceptable stitching and build quality that I feel exceeds the price point.  I have my ID, driver's license, credit card, debit card, and a few bills in my wallet.  I don't think it should hold much more than that, but it probably can.

It was a little tight in the beginning but after stuffing it full the first day it is now stretched out and easy to get cards and bills out of. The reviews about the quality are in my opinion are unfounded. First of all what did they expect it be for the pice, Italian leather?  I admit it did feel a little cheap at first but after using it for several weeks now feel and looks better. The guy that through it away doesn't know what he is missing. This is not a paid review that appears to be happening a lot on anymore.

reviewText: ....but it's not so much so that I cannot wear the product. It's made very well, and the elastic stretches nicely, while still 'pulling' in. I'm not used to all the clips ( that will come with time, I imagine! ) but it's extremely comfortable to wear. I feel it around my waist, but I have no difficulty moving ( or breathing ) with it on. I look forward to continued used of this corset!

I wish I'd gotten a size bigger, but if all works out, then I'm on the right track.

I don't like how the sides poke me though...working through the fasteners will take some time to get adjusted so that doesn't happen.

I have an array of surgical scars on my belly, and they create a lumpy mess even under loose-fitting clothes. Ordinary shape wear doesn't help much. This corset shapes the whole mess into something much more normal looking. It has also helped me lose a little weight because eating too much in a corset is much more uncomfortable than eating too much in regular pants. I can breathe as deeply as I need to when I am in the corset, and I move more quickly because I am not self-conscious about how I look. The price is very good. I'm thinking of buying the next size down as my body becomes smaller.
summary: It does what I need it to do

Im a 5'10 175lb man, with no boobs but a very wide chest and thick ribcage. Sure it is a little bit smaller than I would have liked but I fit into it without trouble. The sleeves stop at my elbow and the front rests at about 3 inches open when relaxed, but I'm not trying to cover anything with this. I am happy with it considering I only sunk 4 bucks into this AND knew the sizing was going to be different.

There are some reviews about the quality of the fabric. I work at a fabric store and I can say the fabric's "quality" is just fine.  It's smooth silk with a knit-like stretch to it, which upon typing this I can see it's not done stretching, which is fine, I get to break it in., Sewn into the edges is a poly-cotton floral lace.

One thing about buying this - I bought three cheapo-chinese lengerie pieces, all from different sellers - and Amazon told me it would take 30-50 days from the purchase. However, I've gotten two of the items in the mail a mere 2 weeks later and Amazon still hasn't updated it in "My orders".
Something to keep in mind when buying international.

So, after seeing the gorgeous, sexy clothing line Patty Boutik on Amazon, I got excited and took a gamble, buying 3 tops at once ( becuase I couldn't make up my mind on which one to get!).  This gamble paid off, and wow, I am in love and very impressed!

This top is well-made, delicate-but-sturdy, sexy, and the size I chose (Medium) fits me perfectly, just like the model (though the sleeves are a little shorter on me, hitting the wrist, as I am a very tall woman with very long arms).

About me:  I am 5'11" and a size 8 (or sometimes a 6), measurements 34B-27-37.  I chose a Medium, and it fits perfectly.  I have a long torso (and so does this top, so it comes all the way down, no belly!) and long arms (I am no stranger to "full-length" sleeves stopping somewhere between my elbow and wrist, and these come to my wrist, so that's impressive).  The mesh, criss-cross wrapped material in the body of the shirt is lovely and very flattering, the neckline is perfect for me, low but not too low (though I have a smaller bosom, so it's probably more revealing on someone with more than me) and, of course, the highlight of this top:  the absolutely gorgeous, eye-catching lace burnout sleeves.  Just the right bit of sex appeal.  And on the first wear I got soo many compliments!

The only caveats:  On me, again, because of my crazy long arms: Though they technically hit my wrist initially, when I bend my arms (which is all the time, being that I use my arms constantly - HA!), the ends ride up to 1-1.5 inches shorter than my wrist, and I find myself tugging them back down several times throughout the day.  Nonetheless, it is gorgeous, and, if you can control the cleavage if you are so-blessed, work appropriate.  :-)  Also, this is one of the more delicate, lacy tops in my collection (though well-made), so you will probably have to be careful about it snagging on rings, fingernails and random things you may encounter like, say, splintered wood on a door frame!

As I mentioned, the other 3 tops I bought (also in Medium) ALSO fit perfectly.  I am a big fan and will be purchasing more things from Patty Boutik in the near future!

I got this specifically to be hung in my Jeeps rear view mirror. It's beautiful. Not too big. The chain is also fitting and beautiful. I have to wrap it around the mirror multiple times it's so long. Beautiful. Worth it for any Wonder Woman fan!

As Wonder Woman, I need to be able to step out in style. Oh, sure, I could always wear my Star-Spangled one piece on a date, but why be so obvious? Sometimes, as Diana Prince (or Crystal Starr Light, as I've lately been known), I want something a bit subtle, but also classy. Oh, and something that will last longer than the day (or night).

This Wonder Woman necklace gets the Wonder Woman Seal of Approval (patent pending). I love it! The pendant has some good weight to it, some great substance, so it won't get destroyed if I happen to need to switch personas on a date to fight crime. I love the crisp lines of my symbol, the shininess of the surface. Gorgeous.

The chain is a variation of the simple ball necklace chain, but I like it. Simple, effective, long enough so that I'm not looking like I'm wearing a 90's choker. The only "problem" is there is no adaptability - the chain is X long, which means should I not be paying attention or wearing the right dress, I may end up Elizabeth Swanning my pendant, if you know what I mean.

Overall, I'm a pleased Superheroine. I wore my pendant last night to the bar for trivia, and while it didn't give me magical powers to answer excruciatingly challenging questions about the Gherkin, I felt it made me stand out in a stylish, classy way. And when I pummeled those thugs afterwards, I didn't lose it in the kerfuffle!

Brought to you by:
*C. S. Light*
summary: Who said I'm not Wonder Woman?

I bought this dress in Hunter Green, size 2x, and was so pleased with it that I just ordered another one--and expect to buy several more... The colors are simply beautiful, material has a very nice feel to it, it machine washes and dries like a dream without any fading, shrinking, wrinkles or fabric issues. Best of all though is how well it flatters my curves, making me feel ultra feminine and sexy! This could certainly be worn in public as a sundress, or a swimsuit coverup. The reason I bought this dress was to replace the decidedly unattractive, unfeminine, unsexy shapeless sleepshirts I normally put on after waking up to wear around the house. After catching a horrifyingly unflattering side view of myself in a mirror----I decided a change was needed. This style flatters my large bust and reveals my smaller waist while keeping my full, less than lovely thighs covered. I wear a bra in a complementary color, which really enhances the look. And I knew it was a keeper when my husband's eyes grew bigger, his jaw dropped, and he got up to turn me around. Yay!
summary: I want this dress in every color... It's that flattering, comfortable, and easy care.

reviewText: This is THE summer dress I've been looking for. I wish they could make this in even more patterns because it's truly worth having several.  I'd love some little 3/4 ruched sleeves.

This dress is fine. I wouldn't buy it if you were looking for something dressy, but for a casual day in the summer or wearing to the beach, it's perfect. I ordered the next size up, hopefully that will work.
Beautiful dress. Fits and feels great!!!!

The turquoise paisley is a lovely blue, with shoulders thin enough to flatter (they're smocked like the waist) but wide enough to cover bra straps. The back provides full coverage, but the front is quite low (the fabric wraps over itself and can gap open) and requires a cami, a few stitches, or an especially low cut plunge bra. The smocking is flattering, though I do wish it either started just a touch lower or the pattern ended a touch higher. It was an especially good fit for me since I'm reasonable busty and much, MUCH smaller in the waist than the hip. Because of the smocking, I used waist measurements and found there was plenty of extra fabric for my hips. I'm also extremely short waisted (I'm 5'6 and all leg) and it fit surprisingly well, coming to my low ankle. Since I don't wear heels, this was perfect for me. (For the record, I currently have around a 36G bust and 37" waist. The 2X fits with enough extra room to drape without clinging and has plenty of room for my gigantic hips.)

The fabric is on the thin side and a touch clingy; I just wore smooth, nude colored panties and bra and it wasn't really a problem. (The texture of lace showed through.) I wore it out one night in Vegas with giant silver hoops and some blingy bracelets and it dressed up as much as you can reasonably expect of a sundress. Both my sisters made me send them the Amazon link :-)  I do wish they made this in more flattering (and less outrageous) colors and patterns; I like the cut of this particular model, though the generous bust space could be a problem for the less well endowed.
summary: One of the better cheap sundresses I've purchased.

reviewText: This is a great dress at an unbelievable price!  The fabric is soft, flowing and NOT see through!!  I purchased the size 2X as I wanted it larger for an easy pool/shower coverup and it's very easy on and off.  It's a bit large for my chest but larger ladies will love the coverage the top provides.  I tacked the closure shut as it was a bit too big, that's not an issue with the dress though - I ordered it a size larger.  I'm 5'10" and it hits me about 5-6" above the ankle, which is just fine - makes it easier for driving and also it's an OK length for me.  If I can make up my mind for another pattern I'll definately order another - most likely in my size to actually wear out.  Very comfortable!!
Very flattering cut and nice pattern. The material is a little odd (reminiscent of work out clothing).  It is not full length if you are average height but more like a tea length or slightly longer.

What a great dress!  As someone at 5' 3" who doesn't get to normally buy maxi dresses that are not specifically petite - this was a very pleasant surprise!  LOVE IT -- really pretty and very comfortable!
summary: What a great dress! As someone at 5' 3" who doesn't ...

reviewText: Really pretty dress that fit perfectly. Just long enough for my 5'2" size 18-20 figure. Very comfortable.  Considering buying another.

This dress is made of beautiful, light material with a lovely pattern, which is why I bought it in the first place. The quality was good and the material is very soft and flowing. I had read all the reviews to be sure that it would fit well. all reviews that seemed like that ladies were similar in size and shape to myself said that it fit well. however, when I received the dress, it was too short both on the waistline and the hem. this dress was definitely made for women 5'5"or shorter. I am 5'9" and this dress was mid-calf length and the waistline hit the middle of my bust line. I am disappointed because I loved this dress fro what I had seen. I probably won't purchase from this company again.
summary: This dress is made of beautiful, light material with a lovely pattern

reviewText: Ive bought two of these now in different colors and love them.  The fit is great, comfy, breathable, you can dress it up or down depending on where you're wearing it.
Beautiful, perfect!

According to the photos, there are 3 different styles of dresses in this same listing - I got the Turquoise Vintage Paisley with smocked waist and light shirring on the shoulder straps.  I'm 5'9", 40DD/DDD x 34 x 40.  I have to buy everything based on bust measurement because I'm a bit top-heavy.  So I bought a Large, based on the measurement for chest size on the Size Chart (figuring that the hip measurement doesn't matter as it's not a pencil skirt and the elastic would be forgiving for the waist size).  Fits great.  Dress has full coverage in the sides for larger chests and the side of my bra does not peek out through the armpit which is a common problem I have with this style of dress (YMMV).  Elastic fits snug against ribs just under the boobs - exactly where you want it to be.  Hem hits 4" above my ankle.  As described and as pictured.  Pay attention to the fabric content: this fabric is almost all polyester and it feels like it.  I don't mean that in a bad way: I love the way the dress drapes and the fabric is a bit textured and is thick enough that nothing shows through.  But if you don't like the feel of polyester then, as beautiful as it is, maybe this dress isn't for you.  I'm going to order more in additional colors/patterns.

**I have to say this because I've seen so many reviews (of this and other dresses) where people complain about the smell of the dress when it arrives from Amazon.  Sometimes the dresses have a funny (not bad, just odd) odor.  I don't know if it's because of the packaging or the warehouse or what.  But who cares?  Don't you wash your clothes?  If you do, that smell goes away with the first wash.  If you don't, you should - because if you're walking around in dirty, sweaty, unwashed clothes then the smell of the new dress is the least of your problems.**
summary: I found it fits me just as described by size chart - as described and as pictured.

reviewText:
I ordered three of these dresses in different colors, as well as a Just Love jersey maxi. Overall, I was pleased with the dresses, with one exception, noted below.  As a note, I was buying this as a nightgown, but I tried to evaluate each also as a dress.
Blue Paisley- the dress fit as expected (I normally wear a small and the small fit perfectly). The pattern was okay, I found it not as pretty in person as online. The length was perfect for a dress. The material is thin, but not see-through. I did not keep this one because I found the waist shirring to be a tad scratchy and not not as comfortable as the others I tried.  I don't think that would bother me as a dress, but as a nightgown I wanted comfort.
Pink- the style and general fit of this were identical to the blue paisley, except that this dress was cut too short.  This dress hit on my lower calf- not maxi length and it would have looked very odd as a dress.  As a nightgown that wouldn't matter as much, and my husband liked the style and pattern of this dress the best. Unfortunately, it had the same small scratchiness as the blue.  It was returned.
Black floral- the style of this is different from the paisley dresses, it does not tie at the shoulders and the waist is different. This is the one I kept and have loved as a nightgown.  It is still thin, yet not at all see-through or revealing.  I found it more comfortable than the other two and I think the pattern looks nicer in person than the picture online.  It fit perfectly.  This dress is a 5 star.

As a note, I also ordered a Just Love jersey maxi.  It was too thin for me to wear as a nightgown (it would have been immodest without a bra), but it was so cute and incredibly comfortable that I kept one as a dress.
summary: Styles vary a lot between colors

reviewText: This is the perfect summer dress. It's comfortable, easy to clean and dressy enough to wear to work with a jacket. At the end of the work day, toss the jacket, and you're ready for a party on the beach.

Bought the tribal-aqua option. LOVE the colors but the cut was so sloppy. They had cut the fabric crooked, so the pattern goes in a crazy diagonal instead of straight. It's very obvious at the waist where the fabric is gathered in. No way I could wear this without getting cross-eyes :) (the pattern is bold, after all, so mistakes really show up!). If they can figure out how to cut the pieces out straight before sewing the dress together, I would love to buy this. Also, be aware that if you are small/petite like me, this runs large. I think so many people complained to these Asian companies for so long that their clothing was too small, and now these companies are no longer offering true small sizes since most people don't need them. In many cases now, the smallest size offered by these companies is way too baggy on me. I am 5' 3", 32B bra, 27" waist, 38.5" hip. So not tiny. I would even be an M with some American clothing companies. PLEASE bring small sizes back.
summary: runs large and cut is SLOPPY

The first thing to  note is that there are several different styles with this listing. I bought the exotic print one with the smocked empire waist in teal and fuschia. I first bought the teal in a medium two years ago when I was 5'5" and 140 lbs. It fit great. I have gained some weight since then (sadly!) but the medium still fits well. The smocking isn't constricting at all, and the empire waist is very flattering-the bottom part of the dress flows over and covers up any muffin top or other issues you may have. The length is also a perfect ankle on me. I will say that I have a long torso/shorter legs,and I am not at all busty. If you have similar measurements but are taller or bustier you might want to go for the large. I currently wear a 6/8 in most dresses. The dress itself is very pretty. The colors and pattern are bold and bright. It's lightweight but not sheer, and you can wear it to a whole variety of events. I've worn it to beach bbqs and also put on a cardigan and worn it to baby showers and church. I wouldn't wear it to a formal event, but you could definitely wear it on a cruise or something of that nature. After about two years of regular wearings and throwing it in the dryer (I got tired of line drying it), the teal one started to get some pilling it and lose thread a bit-kind of the way a swimsuit will after a lot of dips in chlorine, but that was after a lot of wearing and not careful washing, so for the tiny bucks I paid, I definitely got my money's worth! In fact, i came back and ordered the pink! hth someone; clothes are the one thing I get nervous about buying on Amazon because of the sizing.

The quality wasn't great, but for the price, okay.  The colors were true to description and picture online. I got an XL.  it's a little roomy in her bust and just a couple inches shorter than a traditional maxi but the fabric is so soft and stretchy and thin enough for summer but not see through. reviewText: Love this dress. It is super cute and fits beautifully.

Also - I'm 5'10" and it falls to about 3-4" above my ankle bone. Length is perfectly fine for me. Based on what I've seen in other reviews, you can't really expect a maxi dress that's designed to fit the average 5'4" woman to also come to the floor on us tall girls. Not really so reasonable IMO.

reviewText: I have now ordered both the Pink and the Green Vintage Paisley in 3X. While they are the same material and print, they are cut slightly different. The Pink is a wonderful front and back overlay, as where the Green only overlaps itself in the front. Also, the arms are smocked (and slightly adjustable, which is SUPER cool and cute to boot) whereas the Green lacks this feature as well. Overall, I love these dresses. I wish that it was a bit easier to tell the style cuts via the pictures, and i wish that the style was the same across all the fabrics/patterns. I would buy a ton more if i knew for sure if i was getting the style i liked each time. Marked off a star for that, as i like buying all different colors of an item if i love the cut/fit but i am hesitant to do this with these due to the variations. They both fit very well, even people who are very busty, but they would be perfect if they were an inch or two longer. At 5'4" and 40G, these end up around my upper ankles instead of brushing the top of my feet.
summary: Great Dress for the price, each color seems to vary the cut/style however.

In summary: So far the chevron design is it for me.

reviewText: A Masterpiece!!! I checked out MANY rosaries before I decided on this one. I wanted a strong, detailed, St. Benedict's Rosary for my nephew, who is a Catholic Priest. He said he's always wanted a strong rosary made of rope with very strong beads that he could use a lot that wouldn't break. He loves it!!!! I also purchased a second one for my brother who prays the rosary continuously. He was so touched by the gift that he cried when he saw it! He loves his too!! It's a large rosary. I would love to see a women's version of this rosary that would be just a touch smaller!! I would purchase 2 or more for myself and other ladies in my life. Thank you to the seller, "Nazareth," & "Holyland-Store. Net," for a MASTERPIECE ROSARY!!! I give them 200% Positive Review!!!

Short story - great boots, get them, you'll love them.

Ok, before I say why I like these so much I need to say a little about my issue with most shoes.  Unfortunately very few commercially made shoes or boots fit me.  If the length is right, the heel is fine but the forefoot is far too narrow.  If a show is wide enough for my forefoot, it's generally much too long.  Wide sizes don't work either, as my heel isn't wide - just my forefoot.  The result of wide sizes is that my heel slides around like an ice skater, not good.  It seems my feet don't match other humans.  So, I have very few shoes.  The few I have are all barefoot/minimal style as that seems to match my feet better.  Most barefoot/minimal shoes are running shoes, great for ummm... running.  What if you want something other than running shoes?  A few options, but not many.

Enter the Belleville Mini Mil series.  I wasn't sure what to expect really, I've read both positive and negative reviews.  There are two boot styles, with differing amounts of toe drop.  These are the transitions, a lower toe drop than most boots, but still more than the other Mini-Mil boots.  They're supposed to be a transition boot to ease you into minimal shoes gradually.  I'm usually either barefoot or have zero drop so to me, these actually feel like a big heel with lots of toe drop.  Still, for people coming from conventional shoes, it'd likely feel flatter.  It's all what you're used to.

I normally wear a 10, but the 10 in these was too large.  I returned them, got a 9.5 and they fit great.  To my surprise, my heel locks right in, the forefoot is plenty wide for even my feet and the length is perfect.  A boot that fits?  Do they feel like an athletic shoe like some reviews have said?  Not to me, but they are light.  They have good traction, decent ground feel - more than most boots but less than most minimal shoes.  They are instantly comfortable, wrapping your foot snugly without crushing it.  The photo looks (to me anyway) like a coyote leather with greenish fabric inside.  The boots that arrived were total coyote colored, I'm fine with that.  I've taken these ona  few hikes with great results.  They aren't waterproof, but that's a good thing.  They drain fast, and dry fast.  I has no sore spots or blisters even after walking through streams, mud, flooded trails, etc.  Wet or dry, didn't phase them.  The uppers wrap around your leg, keeping out scree like grit, pebbles, twigs, ticks... all out of your boot, nice.  My Merrell barefoot shoes always let in stuff like that, so not having it underfoot is a great thing.

Overall, great boot.  I wish they had a little more ground feel, but they're ok as is.  I wish they had a lower heel, but that's my fault - the other model has lower drop than this one.  I went with this one because the price dropped to $57, so I jumped on it to try them out.  Definitely a good move.  The other model with even less toe drop was still around $120, so at half the price I'll deal with the higher heel.  If you want light boots with excellent traction, and that don't feel like a cast on your foot - I think you'll like these.
summary: Good boots, light, drain fast, dry fast, comfortable - recommended.

reviewText: I originally bought the 10.5 R 115 Mini-Mil as I was interested in a real light weight boot.  I wear 10.5R in several styles of older military Belleville boots made in the USA and love them. However, these 115 boots turned out to be made in China (that is on the label inside), not the USA and they are made on a VERY different form (last) than any other Belleville boots I have owned. When they arrived, it was clear the 10.5 size was much smaller than the other Belleville boots plus the front foot pocket is far wider.  I spent the $20 bucks postage to return them and the $16 bucks postage to have them replaced with a size 11, a size larger than I have never worn. The seller was good with that.  However, even the 11s are a bit short at the toe compared to the other 10.5s - toe bang going down hill and they have an even wider in the front pocket. I'm simply going to give the to the local thrift store and stay with the USA made ones. I have posted a picture of my 10.5R USA Belleville boots next to these 11R 115 Belleville boots and you can see the larger front and the fact that the 11s in the Mini-Mil are still a bit shorter. The good news is they are very light and have a good lace system.  However I would not suggest buying these on line and expecting them to fit like other Belleville mil boots.  Also, they do NOT look like the darker brown in the picture. I asked the company about that and the coyote color is tan at best - much lighter than the picture.
summary: Beware, these are not like the Belleville Boots made in USA.

I'm Army.  Got almost 20 in.  Just got this boot to go with my OCPs.  Got a Regular, not a Wide.  This is the most comfortable boot I've ever worn, hands down.  I could wear these forever.  I may buy another pair.  This is a warm to moderately cold weather boot.  A few things...

Pluses:
--Paracord laces with plastic shrouded tips (well, it's kinda like paracord...it has a tad bit of elasticity to it).
--Light!  These boots weigh in ounces, not in pounds.  My buddy at work wanted to see one, I hurled a boot at him.  He caught it with no effort or recoil.  Light as a tennis shoe.  I literally dash up stairs in these things.  Doesn't feel like my feet are wearing weights anymore.
--Has that nitch at the ankles that allow for easy bending and no special lacing configurations.
--Fits like a glove.  Feels like a tennis shoe.  This boot contours to your foot.  You can feel what you are walking on.  Feels like those trail shoes that are little more than a sole and covering.
--Good ankle support.
--Sole has nice a grip.  It's a Vibram.
--You can sprint in the boots because they are light and the sole is flexible.
--No need for an insole (it comes with one), but you can change it out.
--Breathable.  I wore heavy socks with this boot in July and my feet felt great.
--Sized right (ie: you normally wear an 8 but for X brand shoe you have to order a 9).
--AR 670-1 compliant (w/OCPs).  I bought the brown boot, not the coyote brown boot.
--Break in time is in seconds, not days or weeks.

Minuses:
--The sole is thin.  You may NOT want to feel what you are walking on like you don't in most thick soled boots.  That being said, if you are fearful of having sharp pointy objects go through your boot, this is not your boot.  You'd want to be careful around nails and pungies with this boot.  I say that to mean that most issued boots have a thick enough, and hard enough, sole to stop most penetrations by nails or similar objects.  This one does not.
--The sole is thin.  I pronate.  I get that lopsided heel after a while.  With a thick soled boot, with a robust heel, you can get away with uneven wear.  The heel in this boot is not as robust (hard), or high, as the standard issued boot with it's harder Vibram soles.  It's gonna wear out faster.
--Padding.  There is ample padding for impacts, I don't think it will last for years like a normal issued boot--the sole seems to be of a softer compound than my other issued boots.  And I think the padding will "scrunch" like in a sneaker (under the heel), and thus lose some of its impact absorption.  As for ruck marching, this would be a good boot as your feet are not taking a pounding from a hard mostly inflexible sole.  My only concern is the heel.  There's enough padding there, but I feel it's not enough for repeated long marches (early setting in of "scrunch").  It just seems awfully thin back there.

In conclusion, this boot is very comfortable.  Your feet will love them.  However, you're not going to have this boot around for years and get away with only changing the insole.  In garrison, you'll have this boot forever.  In the field, like if you are Infantry, maybe 1-1.5 years.  This boot will likely wear out faster than the normal inflexible, thick soled, boot.  However, the comfort you gain is worth it.  If you get two pair and rotate them, you should be fine.
summary: Most comfortable boot I have ever worn.

Hands down the most comfortable shoes I've ever worn. I have wide feet and now they have room to expand when I strike the ground. Has all the benefits of running barefoot, with protection against thorns and poison oak. Bonus, takes about 10 seconds to lace up/down. Construction seems solid, I'll see how they hold up in a couple of months.

Within hours of having these on my feet in garrison, I was getting major blisters on my heel. The rest of the boot feels good, but my heels are getting torn up. I was expecting a normal break in period, with blisters here and there, but this is something I haven't experienced with boots before. The heel has zero padding, its just straight leather/suede. I hope with a little time its will be fine, my feet will adjust, but I had to switch back to my old boots for a short period for my heels to get back to normal.

These are great boots for work, play, and beyond. I bought them to replace a pair of hiking boots that left my feet and ankles aching at the end of the day because they were unable to flex naturally. I've realized I don't benefit at all from my shoes molding my feet and ankles into a particular position--in fact it's incredibly uncomfortable and fatiguing, especially over uneven ground. These boots are a great relief. The minimal design is protective yet soft, flexible, comfortable, and unobtrusive. I don't need the high tops for ankle support, but they're good for keeping junk and debris from getting down into the foot and protecting the ankles/tendons from knocks and scrapes. I also wear them as work boots around my farm and they hold up well and offer sufficient protection from wear and tear any the occasional stomp from the horses ;-)

I found the sizing to run a bit small, but buying men's shoes is always kind of a gamble for me... I originally ordered an 8.5 but returned them for a 9. I'm 5'10 and normally wear a women's 10-10.5 shoe, have a high arch/instep, average width foot, and my toe just touched the end of the 8.5's, but the 9's are otherwise perfect and will be great even with a heavier sock. Plenty of room in the toebox, lots of adjustment over the instep, ankle, and leg. Very comfortable :-)

They have a bit too much "tongue" (im sure there's a technical name) material which makes them a little bulky and makes tucking in pants awkward. And these come in an 8-eyelet height, but I'd also love a shorter 6-eyelet version. I'd wear those much more often...

Otherwise, no complaints whatsoever! My return was handled quickly, my boots were shipped right away, and they're everything I hoped they'd be :-)
summary: Belleville, where have you been all my life?

reviewText: Nice boot a little large for the size

I did notice some blistering around where the achilles meets the heel bone, so you might want to start out with moleskin in that area until the boots are properly exercised.

There's not much arch support in these boots, so if that's a problem you could replace the inner sole with something more supportive.

I highly recommend these boots for active people who prefer boots to shoes!

Update: I wore these boot during a GoRuck Tough Challenge and I'm pleased to say they held up very well with no issues. I did however, lay some duct tape along the inside back seam to help reduce rubbing.

reviewText: I've had issues with boots giving me blisters for my entire life.  My last pair of boots I had for over 10 years and gave me blisters every time.  I train & run trails (20+ miles) in Vibrams but couldn't find a good shoe for when I get off the trail and in more rugged terrain.  Went looking for a zero drop boot and found these.  At first, I got blisters fairly quickly and had my doubts that this boot would work at all.  but after wearing them in, I've found them to be the most comfortable hiking boot I've ever had.  I'm less than 40 years old and have been an avid hiker since about age 14 so I've had plenty of opportunity to test out different boots in all price ranges.  These have been the absolute best, hands down.  I highly recommend them to anybody who trains in Vibrams but needs a more rugged boot for hunting, fishing, backpacking, etc.  I can't speak to law enforcement or military duty use.  But for my purposes, they're great.  Best of all, my wife says they don't look like a military boot when I wear them with jeans so I don't mind wearing them in public places.  I plan to coat them with beeswax or some other waterproofing material.  I only wish that they would make them with a waterproofing liner (gor-tex or something like it) to make it waterproof.  Some reviews advised buying a size smaller or larger than normal.  For me, it was spot on (size 10).  The 10W and 10.5 were too big.
summary: I train & run trails (20+ miles) in Vibrams but couldn't find a good shoe for when I get off the trail and ...

reviewText: Typically I wear a 32A. I read in the product reviews that I should order up one size so I went with a 34B. The cup size is perfect but the band is extremely snug! The color is a bit off from the photo and the band is also quite a bit thicker than it appears. In order for the bra to actually provide some "push up," I had to tighten the straps a bit. Doing so made the band visible with almost every top that I had hoped to wear it with.... It comes up so high when tightened that it rubs my underarms raw after about 30 minutes (and no, I didn't have it tightened to the max, it was only about an inch tighter--still the band nearly covers my entire rib cage). I literally couldn't wait to take it off! It does give my itty bitties a great shape and, although the band is super tight, it's thickness is great for hiding all back and side bulging. There are good and bad qualities about this bra.... I don't think I'd recommend it though, as I've never had a problem wearing other push-ups all day long that have provided the same shape benefits that this one did.
summary: Any wider and it would be listed as a corset!

I read a lot of reviews before ordering this and I'm glad I went with my gut instinct to order two sizes up instead of just one. To help some of you out. I'm  5' 2' around 115lb. I would have normally bought my bra in a 34b American size, but knowing this ran small I decided to go with the 38b and it fits perfectly! There's no tightness under my arms like I've read in some reviews, or wires digging in. I can latch it comfortably using the very first rows of hooks, so in reality I probably could have gone with a 36b, but I'm really glad I went with the 38.

The bra itself is beautiful. It looks great on and the material it's made of feels great. I love that the elastic in the bra is thick. It has some give, but it feels secure when you're wearing it, and not like it's going to stretch out on you after wearing it a few times so that you have to keep tightening the straps. I have a feeling this bra will last me longer than my usual ones, and it's definitely one of the more comfortable ones I own. The shoulder straps are adjustable. There were no lose threads or other imperfections I could find on the bra. The color was great. Exactly as pictured. The inside padding is just the right amount for me and very soft. The little polka-dotted fabric inside the cup is super soft and a cute little touch. There are little balls inside the padding, that I've seen other reviews mention, but I can't feel them when I'm wearing it so they don't bother me.

Really great product at an awesome price and I will definitely be ordering another one!

reviewText: The only thing I'd change about this is a pocket on the outside end that could hold a water bottle.

This is the best - the perfect - shoulder bag I've ever had.  It is beautifully designed. There is a zipper on top, a magnetic snap to another compartment on the outside as well as a zipped compartment on the other side. There is also a wonderful, almost hidden small zip compartment at the side where I keep my keys - no more rummaging around in this purse for anything. The inside is lined in a bright fuschia material. There is a soft., padded compartment with velcro closure designed for a small tablet that I use for my Kindle. On the opposite side are places for credit cards, slots for pens and 2 small pockets for whatever.  I also just love the change purse attached with strap and removable metal hook that attaches inside to a metal loop in the bag. No more hunting for dollar bills or change! Everything is easily accesible and easy to see because of the bright colored lining.  Only concern is if the material lining will hold up over time.  There is one zipper at the top from strap to strap. All zippers have metal pulls which make it so much easier to open and close. The strap is super comfortable and can be worn over a shoulder or across the chest, and the weight of the bag is perfectly balanced. And, it looks great. A classy, wonderfully utilitarian every day bag. Where have you been all my life!!
summary: Love, love, love this shoulder bag!

the first time it happened, i quickly got my money back and didn't have to return it to china. The second time, the return shipping was more than what the earrings cost, so bent the post and kept it. reviewText:
This costume is simply atrocious.  I cannot emphasize this enough.  You may read some of these positive and semi-positive reviews, and think you'll go ahead and buy this, but you will definitely regret it.  Best way to describe the costume is it's a backwards Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle costume.  That's exactly what it looks like.  It also looks like a 7 year old child did the graphics and color on it.  There's a lot more white on the mask than what is shown in the item photos (which looks stupid), and the mask is VERY flimsy and doesn't not hold any type of shape that it should.  The eye slit that's on the "missing eye" side doesn't really line up with the one on the other side, and the "missing eye" side also has a mouth slot, which really shouldn't be there.  In the end, the mask it's up looking more like a melted, dented up Iron Man mask.

This is quite possibly the worst costume I've ever bought.  It was quickly returned for refund, and we just decided to go a more expensive route and basically make our Death Stroke costume using a much better quality mask and motorcycle protective armor/pads over black pants and a shirt.  You can buy all the components right her on Amazon -- just search for "Deathstroke Mask" and then scroll down to the section that says, "Customers Who Bought This Item Also Bought" and you'll see the pads, utility belt, sword, scabbard, etc.  It looks sooooooo much better than this it's literally comical.
Great for easy cosplay
Perfect
The mask SUCKED.

  The good: -Heavy and feels sturdy. -Fuel lasts a considerable amount of time once filled. -Keeps time well. -Lights every time without fault. -Comfortable even with the weight. -Strong flame that is not put out as easy as a Bic. - Nice shiny finish not easily scratched. -Looks like a normal watch to people who don't know. -
  The bad: -Uncomfortable straps. -Flimsy straps and buckle. -Hard to read clock hands. -Difficult to light wearing on your left wrist. (I wear all watches on my right). -Did burn my hand once because of the wind. (Nothing bad, just lost a bit of hair.)
summary: Read the pros and cons at bottom of review.

The horns themselves are made of a rubber like material.  There was no sort of inclination to this inside of the product description.  It does feel overpriced for the material it is made of.  However, It fits perfectly and has an adjustable rubber strap.  The horns' placement on ones head is very dynamic, the space between them can be adjusted just as the diameter of the entire strap.  The paint is decent.  It does not flake.  This product's rubber material seems quite fragile and is likely subject to tear if abused.  Overall it is a nice product fit for a halloween costume in need of horns.  Great for portraying Lucifer, a satyr, or other similar characters.

Fast shipping, although the product was somewhat creased against the design from packaging. Fits well and its adjustable. Lightweight and easy to wear. Can play with positioning because set up is very flexible.

My 2 year old has just demanded to be a Wampa for Halloween, and I'm torn between pride (my 2 year old knows what a Wampa is- I must be doing something right!) and panic (uh, how does one make a Wampa costume???)  Fortunately, you really can find anything on Amazon!  Take 1 toddler polar bear costume plus one pair of Satyr horns, and we're 90% of the way there already.  These look great, and I love how lightweight they are.  They are foam, of course, but the foam is very lightweight.  I'll bet you could wear these all day and not feel them at all.  My son is already very excited to wear them around the house!  Now if you'll excuse me, I have a polar bear costume that needs to be Wampa-fied...

These horns where perfect for what I was looking for. I found that a lot of horns listed on Amazon spiral out. These ones are more tight. (If that makes sense.) I was going for more of a Ram look for a Ren fair. The horns are made of a light weight foam which is great if you plan on wearing them for a long period of time. Wore them for servers hours at a Ren Fair and didn't notice I was wearing them half the time. The cons to this is I felt like these are priced a bit to high for the quality you receive. Don't get me wrong these are fantastic and look great but it's honestly just foam. Tad expensive in my opinion. Also the horns are threded with a clear plastic adjustable band that kinda take away from the costume. They where very hard to hide and I have thicker hair. I ended up wearing a flowercrown over the band to try and hid them but even in photos I got back back I could still see the band in some angles. If you have the time and supplies, which I didn't have at the time, I would highly suggest cutting the cord off and glueing clips to the horns and fastening them in that way. It would look a lot better on and you wouldn't have to struggle with trying to hide the cord every 15 minutes.
It came a little grayer than in the photos, but it seems realistic from a distance.

reviewText: Nice and lightweight. From a LARPing standpoint they're soft and collapse under pressure only to take shape again instantly. Great product.

I bought these for a cosplay, I dressed up as a character named Hannah from Rat Queens. I was pretty happy with the quality of the horns themselves but the elastic headband part is a piece of work. It gets tangled in your hair and honestly made the horns not rest as they would naturally on your head. What I ended up doing was removing the elastic band and I hot glued the horns to a sturdy hard plastic headband I bought at Walmart. This left them with little holes in the bottom but it ended up looking a lot better. If you're using these for a Halloween costume you'll probably be fine but if you're doing a legitimate cosplay and are picky like me, you may have to put a little bit of work into making them look professional.
summary: OK quality but annoying elastic headband

Yes they are light but, they are also easily damaged.

As others have said, these are super lightweight hollow foam.  I think that's great, it means I can wear them all day without a headache.  Mine weren't crushed, they were in a pretty firm clamshell package which protected them well.  There are visible seams, a few minutes with nail scissors took care of that and it's what I expected at this price point.  They look great and I can barely feel them on. They came on a whitish clear stretchy silicone cord, I'll be replacing that with one that matches my hair but it was a good choice for the company to try to best fit all hair types.

It may not be water-resistant but it's light and thin (which is a plus for wearing it different weathers and situations), and if 'waterproof' it important to you (it is to me) there are things you can buy (or make) to make it waterproof (without changing the colour). reviewText:
Love the coat....what is up with the very Asian sizing or the T-Rex sizing?!? I am half Korean (Asian) and 5'4 @ 145 lbs.

I have an hour glass figure aka my bumper matches my headlights..wink wink, nudge nudge. With that being said, I purchased a XL size. I'm not shaped like a T-Rex aka short arms, I have a short torso, long legs and arms, not abnormal length arms...okay?!?

I put on the coat and my husband asked, 'why are you trying on a coat for our 9 yr. old?!?. That's right, our 9 yr. old who is 55 inches and 70lbs.
I read the reviews and thought, okay Asian sizing no problem. Sorry folks, it's more like T-Rex sizing or I'm not Asian enough to wear this'.

To those of you who bought this and love it, I'm jealous. It's a beautiful coat at a great price! Loved everything about it....yet, it does not love me like it should'.

I now must bid farewell to a coat I just met and fell in love with' I hope you find that perfect woman that wants to be draped in you....

I know there is a coat out there looking for me, I just need to find it or cancel our planning for a trip to Aussie land'. Meh, ya win some or lose some.... I just lost.
summary: Finally a coat for a T-Rex

reviewText: I am 5'1" and as of this morning 112 lbs. I ordered a small. Due to all the complaints about the jacket running small, I very carefully looked at the sizing information listed in the product description. My measurements fell into the small categories, so I ordered a small in the khaki color. It fits just the way it should, perfectly aligned in the shoulders, good arm length, a few inches above my knees, and plenty of room to wear a sweater underneath. In my photos, I am wearing a sweater with a 32 D pushup from VS--I had no issues buttoning around the chest nor did I feel it was too snug. A medium would've been too big. I have a few other points to make, and an explanation as to why this only got 4 stars instead of 5, but I also have a solution. 1. It is a very nice jacket and is the exact same color as pictured in the description. I am afraid my photos really do not give it justice, but I posted them anyway for you to see for yourselves (and my pup got in on a few of the pics as well)--it really is much more flattering in person! 2. There is no permanently attached label with the care instructions. The only care instructions are on the removable product tag as symbols--translated they mean: do not tumble dry, iron medium heat, do not dry clean, machine wash cold, do not bleach. 3. It has big pockets! 4. It has a little bit of a funny chemical/packaging smell and is wrinkled from being folded for delivery, but I am sure both will go away when I wash it, and let it hang to dry. 5. It is definitely not at all water proof, and not even water resistant, which is why it only has 4 stars. I took pictures to show that if you spatter it with water, the fabric instantly absorbs the droplets--no beading at all. I thought maybe it still kept the water away from the wearer, but I have another picture showing how it will saturate through. Now, I live in Florida, so water proofing is a necessity. Therefore, I will be treating the coat with a product I've found to work great, doesn't change the color of fabrics, doesn't leave any weird residues, doesn't have a scent, and doesn't cost much (you can get it at Walmart and perhaps for cheaper than here on Amazon). It is called Atsko Silicone Water-guard Atsko Silicone Water-Guard 10.5 oz and will make fabrics and surfaces water resistant (if you put enough on, it will make it practically waterproof--I've seen a youtube video where a paper-towel was treated, then completely submerged in water and remained dry). Otherwise, a great jacket for the price!
summary: Very cute jacket :) Just go by the sizings listed!

Amazon was going to refund me since it wasn't going to be shipped to me in the time that I needed, but what was I to do with the jacket. I asked to send me a replacement. When the second one came in, the belts were all there, but the fir was completely different even though the size was the same. The second one was almost an inch smaller in the shoulder area, also significantly smaller in the chest area. The stitching is just weird on the hole thing. I hate to say that I like the way the fabric feels, it's soft, smooth yet it has an extreme fake feel. It's sad that most of the things we get anymore are made in China, this one doesn't say where it's made, but I have a feeling that's where it came from. I still have both jackets here and can decide which and if to keep them. So if you get one and it doesn't fit right, order another one in the same size and it might be better. Dang Chinese clothing.

On a more positive note, the coat seemed to be a good coat - just not wearable for a person who needed an American 'Large' coat. The hat itself is pretty nice. Usually, I buy Bailey hats, but, I saw this hat in tan and bought it. I was extremely disappointed  the shipper didn't pack the hat in it's own box. My hat arrived rather misshaped and didn't look like the pictures. I know, the listing says these hats are crushable; however, once they are crushed it is difficult to get them back into their designed shape. The hat is described as a diamond top, but, after it was shipped, the best I can do is get it into a somewhat round shape. I feel absolutely certain, if the hat was in the shape as shown in the pictures and properly packed in it's own separate box, then these would be extremely cool hats. My hat fits a tad loose; however, I love the fit, because my head can breathe. I haven't worn the tan hat for more than 15 minutes as I may return it to get a hat in proper shape. The gray and black hat hasn't arrived, yet. I'll write the rest of my review after it arrives.
Again, I believe, these hats are definitely worth buying, the price is appropriate, but this particular style of hat needs to be properly packed in a box taller than three inches. A four inch high hat isn't ever going to look good after it's spent two days crammed in a three inch tall box.
summary: Nice hat really needs better packing.

I usually don't write reviews but I had to make an exception so people can know what they are buying. The costume comes with the hooded cape AND a sleeveless black dress which I find to be a very good bargain for your money! The cape is light and allows air flow so it's well ventilated. I'm 5'8 and the cape touches the ground! So this costume is great for tall people! If you're on the shorter side the material is very easily cut with a good pair of scissors. But here comes the ONLY reason I gave it 4 stars. Dress size. The costume only comes in "standard" size and says it fits up to 14/16 which I feel to be not the case. I am 153lbs and a size 8 (34DD) and the dress seems to fit me perfectly. So as I do feel the cape will fit "most", the dress most certainly will not. Just be cautious ladies if you are over 160ish. *But if you are looking for a amazingly creepy yet beautiful cape this is the BEST CHOICE!!!

The dress (included) is a polyester material and has a nice neckline drape.  I am a small size and this can fit up to 14-16, although the dress might be a bit tight for large hips.  I added a black belt to hold up the dress which is fairly long.

reviewText:
My package arrived promptly.  I was not entirely sure about their sizing because on the listing the size is listed as "STANDARD."  Turns out that the label on the package said that it's Size 14/16, which is perfect!  But then again... even if it says Size 2, it would have been perfect because I purchased this for the hooded cape and NOT the dress.

As for the hooded cape... I am 5'4", and even with 6 inch heels... this thing still drags on the ground, which is EXACTLY what I want.  I didn't want something that did not drag on the floor even in heels.

As for the dress... since my regular clothing size fluctuates between 13/14 to 15/16, depending on the clothing manufacturer... the dress fits like a glove.  The material is thin, and somewhat see-thru, but it's pretty standard for packaged costumes.  The dress is pretty plain, it's just a straight tubular shape.  If you're curvy like me, it will hug your curves. However the material is not super stretchy... it has a little bit of stretch, so if you normally wear clothing larger than 15/16... this may not work for you.
Very nice Halloween costume, and received lots of compliments, the material is stretchy so I would think it can fit different sizes

Definitely keeping this costume around for trick or treaters and our haunted house!

reviewText:
Okay, I almost never return anything I've purchased on Amazon. And this was the first time I've ever had to. Here's what's wrong with these sunglasses.

1) The picture gives you the impression that the frames and lenses are champagne colored, with a light tint on the lenses. Not even close. The frames do have a gold/champagne like color to them, but in certain light, they also almost have a rose like tint to them. The lenses are dark brown, and only look like the pictures when direct light is passing through. In other words, they will look dark brown on your face.

2) These are small frames made for someone with a slender face or a child. You get no sense of that in the picture.

3) The item description says these are "unisex", but I disagree. These sunglasses are definitely more suitable for a woman's face. They just have a feminine look to them that is not conveyed in the pictures.

4) For $25, these are terribly overpriced. I've bought sunglasses like these at half the price, and twice the quality. The frame is a rather ordinary plastic. Not cheap, but certainly not high-end. There are no flexible hinges on the stems, and you don't even receive a nice gift box or bag, or cloth for wiping the lenses. These sunglasses should be sold for no more than $10.
summary: Not like the picture, not unisex, overpriced. Pass!

Delivery came in less than two weeks!! It's a bit bigger than it looks and more bright gold than antique gold like it looks in the picture and a bit more like costume jewelry, but for the price and how cute it is, I love it!!

This is another fun piece that is cool, and not intended to imitate fine jewelry.  It is supposed to be a large, wild piece. It has some interesting features to it. Attention to details is also rare in inexpensive costume jewelry, but this piece actually has lots of them.

The entire pendant, which is in three pieces, measures 85 mm (almost 3 1/2 in). The chain, which has a lobster-claw clasp, has filigree links. The pendant and chain are made of a lightweight metal alloy. The pendant also has filigree details and open work. The top section of the pendant is where the bail is located and is the smallest section. It measures 15 x 15 mm. It is topped with a very small cross, a small lilac rhinestone and a small green resin stone. The middle section measures 22 x 28 mm, has wings, and two small green resin stones. The last section is the crescent moon, measuring 52 x 46 mm.  The moon has three large resin stones as well as rhinestones

Then we get to the "stones." The large resin stones on mine are green rather than blue. They are faceted but also have a sheen, chatoyancy to them, almost like a tiger eye or star gems.  There are also numerous crystals/rhinestones in different sizes and colors.  The rhinestones range from 2 mm  lilac to 4 mm deep sapphire blue.

Overall, it is a somewhat gaudy piece that will really set off some of my more interesting outfits!

So, I did a lot of research before purchasing this swimsuit. I am 5"4, 34B, and about 145Ibs. I purchased the XL first because of the other reviews on here and I asked on the Amazon Q&A as well as was advised to purchase that as well. When I received the swimsuit it was too big! The stomach area was too large, the bust area was too large, it was simply not a comfortable fit. Thankfully, FREE returns! So I returned it right away, and took a leap and purchased a Medium. When it arrived it fit perfectly! The falsies did nothing for my already small chest, but the swimsuit itself fit nicely. I have worn in various times now, I believe the fabric to be of nice quality no complains there. It fits comfortably, and hugs my body well. It is not a shaper, so for other ladies who have a belly like me it does not hide that but it is nice for someone like myself who still has some baby belly left and stretch marks I would rather no one see but me. I would purchase this swimsuit again.

I own a gym and often go from working out to working for several hours at a stretch.  These shoes are light enough and give enough support that I don't have to take them off before the end of the day as I do with most sneakers.  I have not yet put them to an "all day" test, but so far so good.

I take an 8.5M shoe and I bought these in a 9.5M. My old New Balance cross-trainers fit a little loosely in a 9.5M. These fit snugly but are not too small. There is a little room in the toe box. Because of the fit my feet don't slide around in them. I wear them with high-impact orthotic inserts. I do very intense cross-training workouts and these provide great arch, side-to-side and heel support no matter how I move my feet. I've worn them only for a couple of hours at a time during my fitness classes so I don't know if they would be comfortable all day. The only problem with the pair I received is that the pink dye inside the tongues of the shoes (I bought the black/pink combo) comes off on my socks. I've worn them for a couple of weeks thinking the dye would stop bleeding but it hasn't so I'll have to return them and get another pair.

Update...  I loved these but they lost their cushion and shock absorption way quicker than I would expect a short of this process to. If it were a more reasonable price I would just order them more often. I will not be ordering these again unless the price comes down drastically.

I use these shoes for playing tennis and pickle ball and find them to be excellent for that purpose.  I met with a foot specialist who tried many many shoes on me and watched me move in them and they thought these were far the best for me when doing stop start activities like tennis.  I do not use them as a walking shoel as I prefer a bit more cushion for walking and these shoes were not really designed for that.  I have moderately wide feet and found that I had to go up half a size, but didn't need to order a wide size.  I think if my feet were any wider I would definitely need to order the wider ones.  They look fantastic on the foot, much more chic than my previous NB hideous all white old school tennis trainers!

reviewText: I purchased NB Wx1267 specifically for working out.  Workout includes a lot of jumping, lunges, lateral moves,mountain climbers, push-ups,  etc.  I previously had a pair of New Balance WW1765 that were wonderful but eventually wore out for workout purpose. I tried other  shoes (Rika & Asics) then even tried barefoot (working out at home on double mat) but ended up with Plantar Faciitis so knew I had to get more serious about what I wear on my feet when working out, especially. I regret ever having strayed from New Balance. So far I am not having a problem wearing these in my workout.  I am seeing improvement in my foot problem but I am also doing foot exercises & stretching more.  The shoe fits just right & is supportive.  The strings are a little short but I am happy with that.  I have other shoes that the strings are so long I have had to figure out ways to multiply tying so I don't trip over them.  I will be sticking with New Balance for working out but make sure to get the right kind for working out.  A sales person at the New Balance Store informed me about these but they did not have my size in stock so I purchased online.

The symbolism and energy of the stones is what drew me to buy from The Potter's Stones.  I was looking for matching anniversary gifts and this turned out being perfect...quite meaningful.

When the two bracelets arrived, there was such great energy.  The stones are nicely selected, with each the same size.  I love the singled out clear crystal and the pretty silver dividers.  The stretchy string used is very thick so the bracelet not only looks expensive, but doesn't feel flimsy.
It's high quality.  One thing to mention is that the bracelet I have on has the three jade beads faceted (instead of polished and round like the others).

I have a 5 5/8th inch wrist so it is a little big on me.  However, I don't want to restring the bracelet as it's significant for me to keep the 3 sets of 7 beads intact.  I do meditate with this bracelet.  What I do is wear this bracelet with another healing bracelet that is also too large and twist them together.  Or just let it dangle...it won't come off.

I don't spend a lot on jewelry and do not regret spending over $50 for two bracelets. Very pretty and of high quality.  Thanks for making something so pretty.
summary: Bought his and hers to celebrate 20th anniversary

reviewText:
This is a beautiful dress, but is is very shear especially over the cleavage.  The slit also is very high, as in just below the bottom of the underwear.  It runs a bit small; my wife is 5'8", 135 Lb, 36C(D) usually a size 8 and a large is very tight in places that can't be changed with diet (i.e. Ribcage, Hipbone).  It does stretch a bit, but this just adds to the shear look. I re-ordered an X large, which usually means a 12+ and it fits her great (like a normal size 8).

This is definitely not a dress you would want to wear to church, but if you want to turn heads this will do it.  When she put it on my jaw hit the floor.

Don't get me wrong, the dress is beautiful and cheap. But, there's no fat people in China! So, their sizes differ greatly from ours. Plus, not many curves on the ladies over there. The fit of the dress was very tight, especially around the chest (beware, D cup ladies). I don't know what I was expecting. I learned my lesson and will not buy clothing from China again. I will be giving away the dress to a family member so at least someone can look awesome. It IS a very unique dress and will definitely flatter a wearer with the appropriate body type. It didn't even look terrible on me, I just value my lung capacity. Oh, and the slit is pretty high up there if you're a taller gal like me (5'6"). You've been warned!
summary: Please read: XXL from China really American Medium or Large at most

I love this swim suit! I have never been able to wear a one piece before.  I am very tall, smaller up top and larger in the hips/butt area. I ordered the yellow version because it was available on Prime and I knew if it didn't fit right I could easily return it, and if it did fit well, for the low price I could order the red in the same size and still have paid less for 2 swimsuits, plus shipping, than one in any department store.

The bottom part is very flow-y and long, it covers all the parts I want covered. The leg parts under the skirt were a little tight and uncomfortable, but I have really big thighs, so I pulled on these a bit and they have stretched our some and you can't tell from looking that that part is too tight.

The top fit well, has just a bit of padding.

reviewText: O.k WOW this has been quite a journey! I may be going through a bit of an emotional purging or crisis haha but I am daring to wear what I want and pushing myself through insecurities in an effort to slay the naysaying, fear promoting, self esteem killing monster within. Grrrrrr! And THIS was the weapon of choice ! I am 5 " 4 122 pounds 38 to 39 hips, heart shaped booty, not at all flat, but not a huge butt ( I say this in case any ladies have a similar build,] and I purchased a large. It fits me like a DREAM I mean literally not a single bulge popping out of nowhere! I purposely bought a large because one of my biggest pet peeves is muffin top! I don't really have one but if I buy anything even a little constricting around my hips I get the bulges, every woman does and its about clothing that isn,t to tight at the hips, so I went up to a large to avoid this. Sooooo glad I did. This suit is GoRGeOUS and looks designer and does not look cheap and now I am even more motivated to keep working out. The self esteem part is in wearing this without a skirt cover up as I am working to really tone my legs and be skirt free..I,m getting there but it has been a journey to walk in this suit with pride and confidence in several beaches in Florida and feel like I,m fitting in with the spring breakers hahaha ( of course with faaaar more sophistication and minus the beer ponging lol)  I would urge you to buy this to fit your hips. That is the most important measurement in my opinion as you can always work with a little larger top if that was the case but the real selling point of this suit are the straps that run across the torso and hips so you definately want that to be perfect .GoodLuck and happy strutting!
summary: This girl is ready to rock! Insecurities be damned!

I a m 5'5", and pre-pregnancy, usually a size S in dresses (occasionally size XS, depending on the brand).  These days I have a big bump and a 34DDD chest.  I ordered a size S and it fits great.  It is slightly form-fitting, but not too tight.  I also ordered a medium in another color as I was a bit worried about growing out of the size S over the next couple months.  The M is a bit too loose right now, but might fit better later on so I'm keeping both of them.

This dress is difficult to rate because it is just as beautiful in person as it is online however I had a difficult day wearing it. This dress looks like the picture. The colors were the same. The shipping took a while but I knew it was coming from China. It is made of a very thin material, maybe the same material as some teddies (lingerie), but still slightly thick enough to wear out in public; I'm not sure if that makes sense, like a thin rayon/polyester type. I didn't need to wear a slip under the dress, seeing as the colors are so rich and dark that you cannot see through.
I had a hard time wearing this dress. If I bent over to carry my toddler I'm sure I would flash everyone and I'm 5'2; this dress layed about 2 1/2 inches above my knee gathered with the belt. Loose it would lay about 1- 1 1/2 inches above the knee. I don't know why but the dress would gather, like static, with my underwear and everytime I walked I had to keep pulling it down, then it was a windy day and it kept wanting to go up seeing as the fabric is so light. It is pleated all the way around and it gathered a little too much in some spots (the front) more than the others, so when I gathered it with the belt I had to adjust the dress so that it looked evenly pleated otherwise it would bulge out right under the bust (I don't know if that makes sense).
But the day I wore it everyone complimented this $15 dress, "that dress is so pretty", "I love your dress", etc, even though I had a hard time wearing it. :)
BTW my 12 year old tried it on too and it fit her although she said she felt the top of the dress exposed her shoulders/back too much. I think next time I wear it I'll wear some tights underneath and call it a top.
summary: This dress has it's good side and bad side.

I ordered this in numerous colors and I'll say first that I love the blue, pink, yellow and beige skirts.  The colors are true, the skirt is about a half-skirt which, on me, is very full.  They seem well made for the price.  The model in the pictures must be below 5 ft so be aware that if you're of average height (5'2 to 5'6) this skirt will be much shorter than in the picture.  I'm 4'11 and when I'm barefoot then the skirts just touch the ground.  In my 5 1/2" heels, the skirts are around my ankles.  It's the perfect length for me.  I'm 33-26-33 and, like I said, the skirt is plenty full enough to look flattering and blow about in the breeze.  The waist is snug but not tight and has still a lot of stretch in it.

Here's the reason for the two star reveiew though.  The green, red and purple skirts are no where near those colors!  What is described as 'red' is actually a very bright, blinding pink!  The green isn't the pretty emerald green I was expecting but is a very drab teal color.  The purple isn't the deep rich purple I wanted but instead more of a raspberry color.  I'd never wear these colors and it was a waist of money.

It fit perfect arrived on time and works like a charm!

I ordered this in a DDD cup (I usually wear a 36/38DDD bra) to wear under a white dress with an open back.  I expected to be disappointed as usual (everyone with a larger cup size knows it's almost impossible to go backless/strapless).  It held up through an entire night of dancing on a yacht.  Thinking about ordering another one just so I have a spare.

I may have ordered this too large.  Every time I have ordered an adhesive bra for a 34DD cup, the bra has covered maybe half of my chest in a really non-supportive and also not-so-smooth under my clothing way.  So, when I saw that this one came in a DDD size, I expected it to run small like others and ordered a size up (the DDD).

Note to everyone out there... this thing does not run small.  The DDD covered my entire breast and then some... to the point that it was actually a little large and showing in the armpit area and at the top of my shirt like a full coverage bra ... Which isn't what you're going for when you are wearing a shirt that is in need of an invisible bra.

I don't count this as a negative, that the product is actually made to fit a large chest.  I will be ordering again in a D and DD cup to try them out.

But, I will say that the DDD cup was a little conical in shape and not the same shape as is pictured on the model in the photo, and that is a little bit of a minus because I felt the coverage and shape were not going to allow any support or lift or hide under your clothing.  You should be able to apply a cup like this to the outermost area of your breasts and pull them in to snap them together for support and cleavage, but this one covered so much that I could have pulled them apart to snap them rather than pulling them together.

The bra adhesive worked well and I'm hoping the D or DD works.  I'm actually thinking that I may try the D (even though I am a DD) because the DDD was so large! reviewText:
I admit, I bought this after seeing all the news reports about V. Stiviano in the whole Clippers debacle. I was amused by the Daft Punk styled anonymity it provided, while also providing shade and UV protection. So I decided to get one, originally more as a joke.
As it turned out, it really is a great product. I myself am a big guy, and the headband fit very nicely - not too snug, and not loose - while the visor itself was not too big, but large enough to cover my entire face. It also is adjustable, up and down, to wear it more as a regular hat-styled visor, or pulled downward like a welder's mask.

Either way, it provides very adequate sun protection, claims to offer good UV protection, and you can see easily enough through it. For anyone who spends a lot of time in the sun, especially gardening or whatnot, I highly recommend this visor. Also, at the beach, when reading or whatever activities you may be doing, this covers the entire face, so you are not having to squint, and it provides better protection against sand blowing in your face.

And I will add that the price was right for what it is. A definite must have for those who want sun protection... or anonymity.  :)

UPDATE:  (I love that Amazon allows updates--no other company does this that I know of, and it's important.)
I purchased the purple rainbow visor when price dropped to $16.50 (now you can get them for much less).  Shipping was very fast, three days.  The visibility is the same as the first one. The headband feels tighter although it is the same size.  Unlike the black one, the protective film on the purple rainbow model was extremely hard to remove.  There were no English instructions and it took me a while to figure out that the dullness on the underside was caused by a second film. The film and the label were actually sewn into the trim, and it took me half an hour with tweezers to get it all out, leaving permanent marks despite trying to be careful.  I took off one star because of having to struggle with the film.  The rainbow effect is easily marred by contacting other surfaces.  Otherwise the visor seems sturdy, but based on reviews I won't leave it in the hot sun.
FIRST PURCHASE:  The basic black full-face visor is just what I need in the Arizona sun. The protective film on both sides of the plastic comes off easily along with the labels. The glare reduction is similar to regular sunglasses, not too light or dark. The headband adjusts down to a small head size, and the tilt is also adjustable.  It's efficient because it saves putting on both a hat and sunglasses, and you can wear it with prescription glasses.  Its ability to shade the whole face and neck is a plus in Arizona, and you won't get raccoon eyes like with sunglasses.  If you're multi-tasking between outdoors and indoors, you can leave it on and still see in both locations.  The price was right, $11.50 with free shipping, and it arrived in a fast four days (Monday to Friday).  The visor is bound to last longer than sunglasses which often get lost or broken.  I will probably succumb to a rainbow one when the price is right, but meanwhile the Darth Vader effect is perfectly practical.  Great invention.
summary: Plain Black vs. Purple Rainbow Visor

reviewText: I like this hiking visor with one or two caveats: the pressure on my head from the open plastic ring to hold it on my head and the blurry vision.  I have worn it for 3 walks of approx 1 hour and it is tolerable but I wonder if those migraines that I have gotten in the same periods are in anyway related to the pressure of the headband/ring. I might take out the plastic and replace it with elastic or something.  The view through the plastic in the visor is not clear - not like sunglasses but at least one gets a somewhat blurry view of the sky, clouds, and trees without the glare... so I like it better than hiding under a hat.
This is the perfect jouvert visor..... keeps  the sun, paint and powder off your face and out your eyes...

Also, the headband gives me a headache after 30 minutes of use, but adjusting the position of the headband every now and then helps alleviate the discomfort.  Also, if you decide to use it in the car, make sure to leave it in a shady spot.  This is the kind of plastic that warps easily in the sun and heat.

This product is way over priced for the quality.
