reviewText: This works well.  I have porphyria and this allows me to go outside in the day.  Along with this face guard, I still use zink oxide and heavy sunblock.

I purchased the visor as a gag after V. Stiviano looked really awesome and ridiculous in it when she was in the news for a bit.
I ended up really appreciating the comfortable protection the visor affords.

It feels great, it's nice and light, and blocks out heat and sunlight very effectively. It's great for gardening or outdoor cleaning. I also took it out for a run and it kept sweat out of my eyes and looked awesome. It's very 'Daft Punk' and I got plenty of stares but no one could see my face which was really amusing to no end :)

It's great as a joke, but it's even better as a visor once you get over the size and novelty of wearing it the first few times.

I don't regret buying it at all.
summary: Bought as a Gag, Ended Up Being Really Handy and Practical (4 Stars)

reviewText: Just received this in the post today. Okay, let's start with the good. I like the fabric. Its cool to the touch, drapes beautifully, a thin/light knit, but not scandalously transparent for our times. It'd be a great warm weather dress. The construction of the garment is pretty great considering how inexpensive it is. The elastic doesn't seem to be tacked down in the elastic casing, so the elastic kinda twists inside of it when its put on/taken off. No worries, since I can secure it quickly with a few stitches. Now, the bad. The size is a bit crazy. If it wasn't for the other reviews I would have been shocked. Yes, its Asian sizing. Yes, they do run smaller scales than American/Western size charts. But really, then the size chart needs to be adjusted to reflect your market and buyers. I wear size 0 to 2, 5' 4" and so, this "Large" dress fits me no probs. THEN the other thing is, the color is not grey. Its a taupe-ish color. Not quite brown or mocha, but lighter than that...ummm...I believe it can be called greige. Its a great item and the price is awesome, and had I known the color was not grey, I would have gotten the black. Correct the item description & size chart you guys!
summary: Its greige, not grey. Correct the item description & size chart you guys!

reviewText: A baby being brought home from the hospital is a very special day for not just the mommy and daddy but the baby too. So in our home we dress nice and dress the baby nice also, to welcome her into her new home and her new surroundings. So for that reason I bought this outfit for her, as I have a little baby boy so it would be kinda weird looking to but him in something that says "lil princess" and has a tutu. But anyways. She is a tiny baby so 0-3 don't exactly fit well and there was no "newborn" size so we just left it be and dealt with it being big. I LOVE this fabric its nice and gentle feeling so its not scratchy on the baby and i ADORE the tutu. We put leggings with it just so that it was warmer for her but other then that the outfit all kind of just "flows" together. You could also get a bigger size and this would be a GREAT first birthday outfit, or for just family pictures. I mean you can use cloths for just anything but there are tons of cloths that are meant for just one thing. I don't like that they don't have "newborn" size (if you are a parent you will understand) because "0-3" is usually big on a newborn and then you go up to a 0-3. But if you have a big baby I could understand ;) but I personally think that over all this is a beautiful outfit and i love it :)

reviewText: i love this hat so much! i have friends asking if they can borrow it a lot, and i almost always get compliments when i wear it out.  it's really nice quality, especially for the price. the only thing is it's not a hard brimmed hat, so it can look pretty wavy and get kinda floppy. it doesn't look bad at all, just know to expect that.

The Diva wide brim floppy hat is slightly larger than my medium-size head, but not to worry, because the strap around the base of the crown could be re-tied for a tighter fit.  The hat is made of heavy crushable felt and although it is mailed rolled up in a small plastic envelope, it unfolds with no real noticeable creases in the crown area, and none on the brim itself.  The brim naturally droops in a wavy fashion as seen in the photo.  I bought two of them, one to make a tricorn hat or admiral hat, and the other one for diva days.  If you want to look like a mysterious sexy diva, this is the hat for you.  We were at the zoo and saw numerous ladies wearing wide brim hats of straw. cloth, and felt.  What is nice about felt hats is you can stream them to re-shape them.  You get a good quality unlined hat for a very cheap price.  The hat does not look cheap.  You can get the look without spending all your money.  Also don't let the estimated lengthy shipping time bother you.  I got them within a week-and a-half.

The CONS:  I ordered a size that I normally wear and man oh man, this is SMALL.  I could probably afford to go up 2 sizes - keep that in mind.  The top unfortunately fits a little large, but manageable if tied tightly, (although has kind of stiff/cheap foam padding feel so it kind of sticks out vs. hugging the chest) and the color red is more like an orangey-red, which I'm not a fan of.  The bottoms, forget it.  I literally was afraid I'd rip the seaming.  Also, the fabric is very thin - but I didn't expect anything too fantastic given the price.

The PROS:  It's a very cute, pinup  look.  The seller is very responsive and friendly.  I requested a return and they responded quickly, warning me that the shipping cost is $12.75, (I mean, the product itself was $12.88 + shipping), so they offered options.  I could order a new bottom for $4.99 (+shipping), or a new top AND bottom for $8.99 (+shipping).  I figure, unless I magically lose 3 dress sizes by next summer, I might as well at least get a new bottom.  :-)
summary: Small!  But amazing service by seller.

I'm an A cup so the top was actually ok, I should of bought the medium. Otherwise, I got so many compliments while wearing this. It helped conceal my "mommy pouch" but look totally cute. I did have to make some adjustments on the top. The middle is wide so I just took a needle and thread and sewed it closer. It worked out because the bow is a tie and covers any alterations I did on it. I would recommend it, but be very careful with the sizes. I'm 5'0 130 lbs and wear a 34A, The bottom was a bit tight, (34 waist, 36 hips)  but I think that had to do with some of my excess mommy weight. So if you're around my body type, the large was perfect. Hope that helps!

I didn't see any major concerns about this right now (because the fabric is plenty elastic-y) but it may be an issue in the future.  Especially if I hear thread breaking every time I yank this suit over my gut.

The top fits but is smaller than I would prefer it to fit.  Especially since most of the time I'm going to have my daughter glued to my hip.  (Also, she currently thinks I have skin bongos glued to my chest.)  This may not be the greatest suit for Mommy/Daughter time.

Other than those two issues, I adore the suit.  It's a good bathing suit material, The ruched waist is great at masking my gut, and my husband thinks it makes me look hot.  BONUS!!!!!

159lbs, 5'0", very small bust & curvy hips. I have a pear shape.  I purchased an XL after reading the reviews. My main concern was that the top would be too large, and alas, it was.  When I originally ordered the suit, I weighed 165lbs, thus the XL.  The suite was originally a little tight around the legs, but now it fits me really well, borderline too big.  The top originally was a touch too large, but it could pass as okay if I tied the straps extra tight.  However, since I've lost some weight, I can't wear the top anymore. Unfortunately, the way the top is constructed, I really can't alter it to fit, either.  I have one complaint about the top: even though there are underwires, when on it feels as though your breasts may slip out underneath at any moment.  Perhaps it is just how it was constructed, but I think I'd be overly concerned about having an 'accident' than having any fun at the beach.
The other reason I had to give this suite a 4 instead of a 5, is because the feel of the fabric leaves much to be desired.  It feels very thin, like there is only one, worn out layer hastily sewn together.  The first time...(and the second time) I put it on, I heard all the seams rip and tear. I'm not exactly sure what that means, but it can't be a good sound.
The High Waist Retro Vintage Bikini Swimsuit is very cute and flattering to those who want to hide their problem tummy areas.  The 50's vintage look is very popular now and the red/blue combo works well. For $10.00, it's hard to find a better deal, too. I recommend this suite for someone who has more of an hourglass or apple shape, where they won't be concerned about the top or bottoms not fitting well. This suite is meant for tanning in the sun and occasional *dips* in the pool.  I would NOT recommend this suite for any kind of swimming or any lengthy wearing.  If possible, use this as your "cute & trendy suite to show off on the beach with," but not intended for getting wet. *Only my opinion, not fact. It's very possible that this suite will hold up find under lots of swimming. I just don't want to be caught on the beach with a suite malfunction.  :)
summary: In this Retro Vintage Bikini, you'll find your inner Fashionista & Save lots of $$$

reviewText: This review is about the sunglasses, but, for some reason, Amazon has questions about shoes, of which I didn't buy as they won't work on my eyeglasses.  These Sun Shield glasses fit over my glasses very nicely of which some people complained that theirs didn't. My glasses are about 5 3/4" across & 1 3/8" from top to bottom which is larger than the "normal" designer glasses that most people wear. The cost is a little high as these are not very strong & won't take too much punishment, but, they are light-weight & are very comfortable. It looks as though the lens can fall out without too much pressure, so I suggest that you should be gentle when you clean them.  I am not active & so far I only wear them when I am sitting down so I don't need a strap to keep them on my face. I wish that we had more choices on the lens color, as I prefer blue for daytime & yellow at night, not these brown ones as I am not getting a true color of the world.  I love the sides being wide with the little window as it does a great job of keeping the sun from hitting my eyes on the side which was a problem if the sun is low in the sky.  I prefer these over the clip-ons & I got the pouch to store them in to help keep them clean when not being used.  +JMJ+

These sunglasses work fantastically because they cover the sides and top of the eyes.  The polarized lens are also high quality.  I have bought pairs for the house and my car.  One pair did lose the tiny screw holding the front to the side.  But the sunglasses still hold together because the hinge is well designed and the screw is not needed to keep the sunglasses together.  Highly recommended.

reviewText: During a recent eye exam, I was told I was developing a cataract in my left eye. Which explained the glaring I've been experiencing. Living in central Texas I get exposed to a lot of bright sunlight. So to maybe help slow the progression of the cataract I purchased these sunglasses. They are great at minimizing the UV rays. I find driving during the day is a lot more enjoyable while wearing these. That is what made me really sad when I went to put them on today. I discovered the leg on the right-side snapped in half. Since I use these glasses just for driving I kept them in my center console (in the cloth bag that they came in). I guess they got pressed up against something else and that was enough to snap the thin piece of brittle plastic that the sun glasses are made from. I'm going to try to glue the leg back together, but not too sure how successful that will be. At least I got a couple months use from these. I'm going to make sure the next pair I buy is made of sturdier stuff.

reviewText: These are much wider than they appear online. I am replacing another pair that I have used for several years because one of the legs finally broke. I like the fit of the Solar Shield Square better but since they all look ridiculous, it's not worth the trouble to exchange. My main reason for using these over the glasses polarized sunglasses is that they are amazingly effective for driving. I am able to drive for much longer periods of time than before I started using them. I have been able to drive trips of 14, 17 and even 20 hours for the past 3 or 4 years. People don't realize how much energy is used by squinting all the time. And most people don't even realize that they are squinting until they put these sunglasses on. So the bottom line is that even though I don't particularly like the fit of this item, I absolutely recommend that you use this or a similar product if you drive long distances.

reviewText: The over the top sunglasses are exactly as advertised, at a much better value than retail stores.  They are not glamorous, but they do as advertised and are functionally what they say to be.  I have several pairs of eye glasses, and there is only one pair that these do not work well with, due to the size of the eye glasses.  They are good for average to smaller frames.  The polarized lens are of a good quality and the beefy hinges will likely hold up well beyond my breaking or scratching one of the lens.  Typical for Amazon, they are of sound quality at a value price.
I was a little worried that they would not fit over my glasses, but they do fit perfectly - and have a good non-glare feature -would recommend
I'm not sure how they would do as sunglasses.  It's just that they are HUGE.They fall off my face.  It's like a windshield!  Not flattering for a woman AT ALL.
Fit great over my glasses. Really helps in bright sun. Nose area is a little uncomfortable over time. But great find would buy again.
LOVE THE PRODUCT.  THEY FIT OVER MY REGULAR GLASSES AND AREN'T BULKY. I STRONGLY RECOMMEND THEM. gREAT AT BLOCKING THE SUN.
These sunglasses are much better than anything i bought from a retail store. Good quality and should last for awhile with normal wear.
I was disappointed, because they are much larger than I like.  The description said "fits all," but the size is not what I have used in the past.
I did like these Glasses  very cheaply made they were  damaged had spots on both lenses they were returned. Very unhappy with this purchase.
I would not recommend these glasses to anyone they seem very cheaply made do not fit over my glasses correctly.

To return these glasses would cost about $6, and was a hassle to do. So we are keeping them as a back up pair. The width of the glasses is significant. Glasses are 2 inches tall, and about 6 1/4 inches wide. Too big for both my husband and me.
not quite what I expected.  too dark.  the frames do not fit my glasses. they are too small for my frames

The small lenses in the sides started popping out after just a few days, and were lost completely after a few weeks. The bows squeeze painfully behind my ears and the bridge across the nose is very uncomfortable.

The sunglass is generous enough to fit over regular glasses without the clamping effect that annoys the temples. The lense is generous in size, not real dark. The small lense in the bows avoid the problem of having bows that reflect light through the plastic.

These sunglasses fit over my regular glass.  My prescription darkens in the sun but does not darken while I'm driving so I squint.  These sunglasses solved that problem.  They are comfortable to wear and I hardly notice that they are over my glasses.  I have even left the car still wearing them.  Highly recommended.

These sunglasses are attractive and do fit over my glasses and block the sun, but they are huge!  They barely fit into the overhead holder that my car has for sunglasses.  I have had other fit-over sunglasses, and, even though those came in a couple of sizes, none of the choices I shopped for in person was as large as these. Since I only use the Sun Shield when driving, I have decided that I will just pretend I am movie star while in my car.

I wear glasses and while they are Transitions, they don't change in the car. I hate the glare off other car windows sitting at a stop sign or on the freeway, the harsh light by the pool and these fit right over my glasses comfortably AND reduce that annoying glare. The color is warm and I like wearing these best in winter. Great value and 100% do-what-they-claim!

My big head challenges a lot of products. But these fit comfortably over my glasses. They're light and the fit is good. With the wraparound style, you almost forget you're wearing them.

I use them mostly for driving. They are a little too bug-eyed to make a positive fashion statement.

The only regret is that the brown frame/lens version has just a little more "flare" than I'd like. (Ok, it looks like something my grandmother would wear.) So I'm limited to the black frame and smoke lens version.
this item BROKE the minute I picked it up. the quality was poor and I would not purchase anything again!

These may not be the most stylish sunglasses option, but they work great, are much cheaper, and are easier to deal with than switching glasses.  I use them for driving, and absolutely love them.  One small thing that may be of note to some of you: the side lenses (in your peripheral vision) have a rainbow effect.  It did not bother me at all, but I did notice it, so keep that in mind if you would dislike that.
summary: MUCH cheaper alternative to prescription sunglasses

reviewText: Great fit over my glasses with the polarized lenses I needed.  Clean easily and do a great job on glare
These glasses were huge!  They are a lot larger than the medium fit over sunglasses at the drug stores.  They are also a lot more square than the picture appears.
I love these because they are about medium and they fit my face very well. they are very easy to care.

I love these glasses.  I have a bigger pair of eyeglasses and these fit over them just fine.  I'm a 36-year old woman who has cool eyeglasses, but doesn't care so much what people think of me when I drive around in my minivan.  I

 think they're fine for driving around in car, but they're not exactly stylish because it's obvious what they are - sunglasses to fit over another pair of glasses.  Husband thinks they look like "blue blockers" or something like that and, jokingly, says it's hard for him to look at me in these.  He clams up when I ask if he'd rather I pay for prescription sunglasses. :)
summary: Not super stylish, but do the trick!

reviewText: Not the best fit for me. These are so wide that they leave a big space between my face and the edge of the lens, making them useless in some lighting situations. And I have a big head...

Love love love these - I have a few different pairs of glasses and these fit over all of them and look really cool. Word of warning - the polarization makes the read out in my Prius invisible. But it's easy enough to just flip them up for a sec to glance at it.
summary: I love these - so much better than script sunglasses!

reviewText: I have several pairs of these sunglasses-all with broken temples.  The sunglasses fit well and work, but the temples are too thin and will break after a short while even with good care.  Previous Solar Shield sunglasses had much thicker temples.

I bought these for my brother-in-law and he just sent an email saying they are great.  They fit prefectly over his glasses and gave him wonderful sun protection while golfing in Myrtle Beach recently.  As a matter of fact, several of his golfing buddies asked for the information so they can order a pair, too.  And, the price was good.
the color was a lot less contrasty than it looked in the picture which was good because I ordered them in spite of their appearance and not because of it. they fit perfectly over my glasses.
The glasses are finel I ordered large by mistake, but that was my fault.  I would get these again if I need some.

I really like having safety glasses over my prescription glasses when shooting.  Just a prevention against scratching and the side and upper shields help guard against hot cartridges bouncing behind my glasses.

These are great for over my glasses while driving.  I have transition lenses and am fine when walking around.  However, I find they do not change through the windshield if the car.  These are great for driving, I finally can stop squinting in the sun!  I just wish they came with a case.  Otherwise they are perfect!  So far I can't find one to fit them.  But I will keep looking!  These are very sturdy and worth the price.  I would buy again even without a case.

I wear glasses only when drive and didn't want to have two pairs of glasses for driving. I just bought LensCovers Sunglasses - Wear Over Prescription Glasses - Size Small- Polarized (B0061RSKTE and they work perfectly. For a week, they are very weak and I suddenly got a wide scratch even not noticing where. This made me uncomfortable to drive. I decided to try another one and bought this. I didn't like to wear it from the very beginning. Drove one day only. The image in this glasses looks like I'm looking though the photo film, transparent but with distortions. They also adds some blur. Going to return this one and get another LensCovers. They also have plastic lenses, but the image is perfect. Will have to keep it more carefully.

Fit beautifully over prescription lenses. Great sun/glare protection. Very comfortable. This recent purchase was a replacement for identical pair which I inadvertently dropped one night as I was coming in from the car. The dogs found them first. All that was left for me to find were the lenses which are evidently virtually indestructible. The frames, however, must be delicious as only a 1-inch piece of the ear piece was ever found. Ordered these replacements immediately as I cannot abide driving without them. They arrived pronto and are every bit as wonderful as the originals. Solar Shields have been a dismal experience, breaking far too easily in the exact same place everyone else seems to have had, and they are not nearly as comfortable to wear. The Solar Shields fit almost too closely, causing fogging of my corrective lenses. Sun Shields, Sun Shields, Sun Shields are the answer.
summary: Sun Shields Are Great!! (Beware of Solar Shields)

reviewText: Glasses were priced adequately, but they are not very durable. This is the second pair, after returning first for lens that were ill fitting. Hopefully, these will last longer. Lens also was not as dark as hoped for.

While the ad claims that they fit over regular glasses rhey do not! I neded "over" sunglasses and these were a total waste of money If you are buying sunglasses,there is no reason to buy these the lens size if jusat too small

These may not be the most fashionable sun glasses, but they do not look bad and they are great to keep in the car.  I love them when I am driving because they block the sun coming in from the side window as well as from the windshield and fit comfortably over my regular glasses.  It's much easier than switching back and forth from my regular glasses to my prescription sunglasses.
I had been looking for reasonably priced fit over sunglasses that didn't look like my grandmother's glasses. These are stylish, lightweight and block the sun on the sides, too!
Upon arrival, a lens had popped out of the frame. A manufacturing problem. Difficult to reinsert. Wiggly. I will need to glue.
They are very stylish but I thought the lenses would be lighter amber than darker amber.  Will look more carefully next time.
These glasses are dark, but not evenly so. I doubt they are polarized. They seem cheap and I wish I did not buy them

I loved these sunglasses. They fit perfectly over my glasses and are just what I wanted. I was skeptical because of the price, but they were much better than I expected. I am going to get another pair so I can just keep a pair in each car!!
Bought to replace a lost pair of solar shield sunglasses because of the great fit over glasses and outstanding wear I have experienced in the past.
They cover my glasses, but they're too big to wear in public.  I look like "the Fly".  I just keep them in the car for driving.

Really like ! Fit me very well,hardly know i am wearing them! Very happy with my purchase  thanks . quality is very good. Fit very well. They fit over my prescription glasses comfortably.

  Martha V.

These sunglasses are absolutely huge! While the frame is very pretty, the only one I can imagine this being good for is a very husky male. As an average size woman this was so oversized that I couldn't wear it even if I got it for free. The return process with Amazon was great. They arranged for UPS to pickup promptly.
Wish they would have come with a case because that would have been really cool so the lens wouldn't get scratched
They are okay. They let me see into the water when I am fishing. That's all I ask for. They are a little tight and make my ears sore, but only after 3 or so hours of continuous wear.

I am legally blind and just purchased a new pair of glasses. I went all out with them. Got the tint on them but it wasn't enough. So glad these don't make you look like an "Old person" with those other huge fit over glasses.
They fit perfectly over my glasses, yet they are talking about to reveal them. They are lightweight and stylish. I love them!
These are wonderful glasses. My hey fit snug over your glasses and block out the sun better than most I have tried.
WOW - these are BIG. I crack up when I get a look of myself in the mirror. But they do what they're supposed to do; cover my regular glasses.

I have half a dozen fitovers. This one is the least expensive and works fine, at least for driving, which is how I use it. It's a real bargain. Unlike more expensive brands, this one has no carrying case or neck strap, which is fine for my purposes. But I'm glad I have a few other pairs that come with those accessories.
These are exactly as advertised. Polarized lenses take a lot of strain off my eyes and they are very comfortable over my glasses.
I don't care for the shape, but the polarized lens is totally worth it.  I use them, which is better then them collecting dust, I just wish they fit my glasses better.
The product is as described. It does fit well and light fitting so they stay on and side vision is adequate. For the price, I would recommend them.
These glasses hit the mark! I have transitional lenses and I was still having glare issues. These sunglasses took the glare completely away. So happy with this purchase.
These glasses are more stylish than the original "old lady" glasses they sell in stores. If you like dressing up and style, you will love these glasses.

Well, I read previous reviews so I wanted to try these for a while before rating them. I think I have had them a little over a month now. I am 58 years old so imagine my surprise to find that I have a cataract. So the eye doctor was definite - I must wear sunglasses at all times outdoors and driving. I live in Florida, wear trifocals so I didn't want to spend on expensive prescription sunglasses that really do not fully shield the rays.

These seemed a reasonable solution. These kind of wrap around your prescription glasses like a visor to keep rays from coming around them into your eyes.

They shield well, have decent peripheral vision. The top part hits my eyebrow - I get why it has to be like a visor but that eyebrow thing bugs me. I found a smaller pair at Walgreen,\'s but they do not have the good peripheral vision of these. These are nice light color for driving, protect from glare around water and are nice even when the sun is not real bright.  The price is also a little higher than the ones Walgreen's sells. Overall they are OK and I am using them daily. Until they break.
summary: Good For Driving, Uncomfortable for long use

reviewText:
I ordered these to see if I would like using fit over sunglasses and surprisingly, I really like them. Lightweight despite being very large, they are easy for me to pop on and off.  The polarized lens cut the glare and make driving easier; it took just a little while to get used to driving in them.  I have very light eyes and they tire quickly in bright light and these help so much. My glasses have transitions darkening but in the car they do not darken enough for my taste.
On the rare occasion that I wear contacts, I find myself preferring these over my much darker and more expensive sunglasses. The brown frame looks like regular sunglasses to me.  I have been using these for a few months and they seem to be holding up without getting scratched up or stretched out of shape. I will be buying another pair to keep in the car- especially at this great price.

I purchased these sunglasses to replace the ones I had lost.  They were a little too big, and I should have purchased the next smaller size, but they are otherwise perfect!  They protect my eyes from the glare of the sun, fit over my prescription eyeglasses, and I don't have to purchase $300 prescription Polarized "sunnies" to lose overboard. And they were not as expensive as what I have been paying at an outdoor sports shop - nor did I have to drive 20 miles to purchase them.  They arrived quickly, and I can live with the larger size.

I wish it was slightly large to fit over ny prescription lens better. Also opening and closing the arms is difficult I had to oil the hinges.  This stiffness may cause  the four Polaroid lenses lenses to pop out !!!

Update 11/20/15 - the lenses in these glasses pop out too easily. The side lenses particularly. I used my Bondic repair kit I bought on Amazon to run a bead line of this plastic welding material around the edge of each lens to keep it from popping out. The side lenses fall out by them selves, so I use the Bondic to keep them in. I think the quality of these sunglasses is dropping with respect to the lenses fitting in the frames. If you are not handy with things like securing the lenses in the frames, you may want to pass on these. Or be very careful on how you handle them and keep them in a case at all times they are not being worn.
My wife has been using these sun shields over her prescription glasses for years. She broke her last pair (they are not as durable as more expensive glasses, but will last several years if you are careful) and could not find a replacement locally. I searched Amazon and found these. There are a lot of these brand glasses on Amazon, the trick is finding the right size, many do not give these size in the product description. They come in 3 or 4 sizes. These were identified as S/M and said to fit over most women's glasses and men's small glasses. These were perfect for her. They are also Polarized which helps with glare. Since they ship under Amazon Prime, we got them in less than two days. If they lasted for 6 or 8 years I would give them a 5-star. If you are rough on sunglasses and drop them on hard surfaces or mash them in your purse or bag you may not like these.
summary: Good Quality except for lens retention

reviewText: I bought these because I got tired of switching over with prescription glasses. Wasn't sure I would like them at all, but they are handy and I do like them very much! A little bit large but then that's a necessity if they are going to fit over Rx glasses.
The mediums are way too big....look like a Florida older woman, lol! so I may order a smaller version. Overall, I feel my eyes are being protected very well.

I look like an alien wearing these. And you can see my glasses through them which looks odd, though maybe that is a good thing since once people see them they can probably figure out why I am wearing such monsters.

I purchased these and a $50 pair of Large-size Vistana over-the-glasses sunglasses, and these fit better.  The problem with the Vistana is that when they go over my glasses, the inside rim sits on top of my glasses and my glasses bear the combined weight on my nose.  These rest on my nose, taking the weight off my glasses.  Maybe if I had smaller glasses or a larger model of Vistana, they wouldn't cause that problem.  Also, the Vistana's temples (the parts that go alongside your head and over your ears) are about 1/2" shorter than these.  Again, maybe if I got the XL-size Vistanas, they would work better, but I don't want to shell out another $50 to find out.  I'll be interested to see the scratch-resistance of these Sun Shields.  I previously used Cocoons, which seemed to scratch easily.

They arrived timely & were reasonable in price. I should have paid attention to the size as they are larger than I wanted. Very functional. Would just pick a smaller frame size the next time.

Chris T.

I have had the sunglasses for a short time and unbeknown to me one of the side pieces of sunglass fell out.  This indicates poor quality.  I can't even find the piece in order to try to replace it.  The other thing is and it is not the product's fault is that the glasses are too large for me. That is a problem resulting from buying on line and not being able to try it on before buying.  Buyer beware.
summary: Problems---one avoidable, the other not avoidable

reviewText: I have light-sensitive prescription lenses ("Transitions") which get pretty dark in the sunlight . . . but lose the darkness inside my car with its tinted windows.  These are a perfect solution for use in the car over the Transitions lenses.  4 stars because they are pretty dorky.
way too big and loose I have other fit over sunglasses and they are fine.  would not recommend this product.

As she says, "They're pretty good at keeping the sun out of my eyes. And they do fit over my glasses!" Since these were the major reasons for getting the sunglasses, we can't complain.

Cons: They don't stay on as firmly as another pair we have, so they aren't perfect.
summary: Bought these as a present for my daughter

reviewText: I leave one pair in the car and one in the house.  Easy to put on and off.  They are durable and comfortable.  The glasses cover 95% of my viewing area.  Wouldn't drive in the Florida sun without them.

I discovered "fit over" sunglasses last year and now own several pairs.  These are the best for the price.  Very nice amber lens, protection from all sides, a perfect fit over my everyday glasses.  I used to wear contact lenses but have lapsed for a number of reasons.  This new sunglasses design -- that fits over regular glasses -- makes the combination a dream.
They fit perfectly, were inexpensive and arrived in about 18 hours.  They work well and do the job. I'm very satisfied.
summary: Fits Over worked out just great.

reviewText: I used these glasses on my trip to Hawaii.  I have had a hard time finding glasses that fit over my regular glasses.  The glasses fir perfectly.
summary: Fit over my glasses better than others I have tried,

reviewText: I use these glasses in all kind of weather.  They work great in bright sun, and also when the snow is flying.  Best of all, they fit over my prescription glasses.
The ones I ordered had a side window cover missing. Not a good impression. Will not try to reorder again.
The only reason I didn't give this product 5 stars is that I also own a pair from the manufacturer, Haven, which are of higher quality.  The product from Haven costs $36.
they are ok but still haven't tried thhem in longer events/trips... heard that the other brands are too heavy, hope this will be ok

It is roomy and slouchy.  The hardware and classic shape makes it a keeper for me. Nice for the price. Be aware that only the flaps,are leather.  I guess Pu means faux in Chinese.  Mostly soft vinyl buy nice for the price.

I got many compliments on it the entire evening of the wedding!
This clutch is very pretty and sweet looking. The shade of pink is very pretty. The material is soft and silky. It would be perfect for bridesmaids and to pair with a romantic dress.
Got this for my wedding day.  The metal parts got caught on my dress and made a snag in the dress.
I put my small LGLeon phone and a lip gloss in the purse and closed it. The fabric came apart from the metal on the top. I was disappointed but was too late about asking for a refund.
My daughter used this little clutch for prom. It matched her wrap, her shoes, her earrings and her finger nails. It held everything she needed for the evening. Perfect size!
Really pretty and nice size.  Seems well made too!
Beautiful clutch, easily fits my large smart phone in it.

Loved but ordered to go with a Flapper costume that I returned because of fit, had no other use for the clutch but considering the price, it was very lovely.  After returning, I actually needed it for a wedding. Oh well!

reviewText: This came a day late but it is a very pretty little clutch. For the size it holds quite a bit. These attach easily on the inside, so if you're carrying this without any straps there are not those obvious 'holes' in it like some other bags. I hope these are always available, because while I did buy the gray one I'd most certainly buy other colors as needed.

I ordered these fir my bridesmaid's.  Perfect size. There is enough room for a large cellphone and an id wallet without looking over stuffed.

I chose to carry it but the chain seems sturdy and looks really nice with it, too. Definitely a good buy if you're needing something elegant at an affordable price.

reviewText:
It's a good scarf, but most definitely not 100% as advertised. While some nitpick about the "wool blend" I realize that that means there is a blend of other materials with the wool, so I was prepared for that. I wasn't surprised at all that it felt like it was primarily manmade materials, especially at the price I paid. There is no room to whine about "pashmina" when the list price is only $15.99 and you're only paying $4.99. 'Cause honey, that ain't real pashmina to start with at that list price! ;)
The reason I rate this three stars is because although the quality is about what I expected there is a distortion in representation in the photo. The shawl pictured looks at least twice as thick as what it really is, even when the actual product is doubled over on itself. Also, while the pattern is lovely the colors aren't as vibrant as pictured.
All that said, this was a Christmas gift for my cousin and she loved it so that's all that really matters to me in the end. :)
summary: It's okay, not exceptional in anyway, obviously not pashmina, but a good look for a cheap price

I am so disappointed, I'm a BIG amazon shopper and this is truly the first thing I've received that is truly, just terrible.  I took a chance with it not being a Prime item but had high hopes.  This came and the stitching was separated at the side seams.  I couldn't even try it on for fear of ripping it further.  The stitching is really not good, there are skipped stitches everywhere and it just looks bad...bad, bad, bad!
